verseObjects.text: Then Jonah prayed to Yahweh his God from the fish's stomach.
"I called out to Yahweh about my distress
from the belly of Sheol I cried out for help!
You had thrown me into the depths, into the heart of the seas,
I said, 'I am driven out from before your eyes;
yet I will again look toward your holy temple.'
The waters closed around me up to my neck;
the deep was all around me;
I went down to the bases of the mountains;
the earth with its bars closed upon me forever.
Yet you brought up my life from the pit, Yahweh, my God!
When my soul fainted within me, I called Yahweh to mind;
then my prayer came to you, to your holy temple.
They give attention to useless gods
But as for me, I will sacrifice to you with a voice of thanksgiving;
I will fulfill that which I have vowed.
Then Yahweh spoke to the fish, and it vomited up Jonah upon the dry land.
